content:
That's great to hear you're working on your fingerpicking technique with Alex! Finger independence and strength are crucial for blues guitar playing.

For finger independence and strength exercises, I recommend the following apps and software:

1. **Finger Independence Trainer** (iOS, Android): This app provides a variety of exercises to help improve finger independence, dexterity, and strength. It's a great tool for building finger coordination and speed.
2. **Guitar Tricks** (Web, iOS, Android): While primarily a lesson-based platform, Guitar Tricks has a section dedicated to fingerstyle and finger independence exercises. You can access a range of lessons and exercises specifically designed to improve your finger dexterity.
3. **Yousician** (Web, iOS, Android): This popular app offers a comprehensive guitar course with exercises and songs to help you improve your finger independence, strength, and overall guitar skills.
4. **Fender Play** (iOS, Android): You're already using Fender Play, which is great! In addition to learning songs, you can also use the app to practice finger independence exercises and build finger strength.
5. **Guitar Pro** (Web, iOS, Android): While primarily a tablature editor and player, Guitar Pro has a built-in exercise module that includes finger independence and strength exercises. You can create your own custom exercises or use the pre-built ones.
6. **Hanon Exercises** (Web): The Hanon exercises are a set of piano exercises that have been adapted for guitar. They're an excellent way to improve finger independence, strength, and dexterity. You can find many online resources and videos that demonstrate these exercises.
7. **Finger Stretching and Strengthening Exercises** (YouTube): There are many YouTube channels and videos dedicated to finger stretching and strengthening exercises specifically designed for guitarists. You can search for "guitar finger exercises" or "finger independence exercises" to find a wealth of content.

Remember to practice these exercises regularly, even if it's just for a few minutes a day. Consistency is key to building finger independence and strength.

Keep up the good work with Alex, and don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions or need further recommendations!
